meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I lent my book to my friend.
meanings.sent2: She lent me her umbrella when it started raining.
meanings.sent3: I lent my pencil to the talking parrot, but it didn't return it!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness lent a warm glow to the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun lent its rays to brighten up the garden.

meanings.definition: To give temporary use of something on the condition that it will be returned.
meanings.sent1: Can you lend me your pen for a minute?
meanings.sent2: He always lends a helping hand to those in need.
meanings.sent3: The magician lent his hat to the rabbit for a magic trick!
meanings.sent4: Her smile lent a touch of sweetness to the moment.
meanings.sent5: The wind lent its strength to push the sailboat forward.

meanings.definition: The period of 40 days before Easter, observed by fasting and penitence in the Christian calendar.
meanings.sent1: During Lent, many people choose to give up sweets.
meanings.sent2: The church is decorated with purple during Lent.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat decided to play pranks during Lent.
meanings.sent4: Lent is a time for reflection and spiritual growth.
meanings.sent5: The somber mood of Lent enveloped the congregation.
